p: Elite athletes are predisposed to the common cold due to heavy physical and mental stress which may suppress both innate and adaptive immunity. 1–5 Air travel, human crowding, housing with other athletes and competition all increase the susceptibility of an elite athlete to the common cold. 6 The Winter Olympic Games take place during periods of low temperatures and its timing coincides with epidemics of many respiratory viruses. The common cold has been said to be ‘the most dreaded opponent’ at the Winter Olympic Games, and may ruin the athlete’s long-term goal of success. 7
